channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2024040731
item.description:
Report X-2024040731

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: COUNCIL BLUFFS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17761
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03-21-2024 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Transportation employee that an FRA Hazmat inspector observed liquid around the Plug of the Liquid valve in the protective housing on Tank Car # PPRX55097 while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Council Bluffs Yard in Council Bluffs, IA. A CN response contractor was dispatched to the yard to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found liquid around the plug of the liquid valve. Plug was tool tight (not able to move by hand) but no teflon tape was observed. The CN emergency response contractor ensured that the valve handle was seated properly. Plug was removed and liquid was observed between the plug and valve seat. Liquid was cleared and the valve seat was observed for 5 mins to check for any continued leaks. Protective housing was then secured using an HMRI security seal.

item.title: Report X-2024040730
item.description:
Report X-2024040730

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: COUNCIL BLUFFS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1688
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03-21-2024 the CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified by a CN Transportation employee that an FRA Hazmat inspector observed liquid pooling around the Blind Flange of the Liquid line in the protective housing on Tank Car #UTLX 110020 while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Council Bluffs Yard in Council Bluffs, IA. A CN response contractor was dispatched to the yard to investigate. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found that four (4) bolts on the Liquid Line blind flange were less than tool tight. The CN emergency response tightened the bolts, stopping the leak. The contractor observed the flange after tightening for 5 mins to ensure there was no further leakage from the flange. Protective housing was then secured using a HMRI security seal.

item.title: Report E-2024040379
item.description:
Report E-2024040379

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding ripped and torn bags of Sodium Nitrate as a result of improper loading / inadequate preparation for transportation. This resulted in approximately 10lbs of product impacting the trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release and containerized all of the damaged product into two poly drums for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this release.

item.title: Report X-2024040605
item.description:
Report X-2024040605

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found wet during trailer unload. No other packages are known to be affected by the leaks. The package was secured in a plastic-lined tote and removed from the work area. It was placed in the hazmat cage until end of sort when reports are then processed. DescribePack: The package may have been transported on its side. I found two of the three containers with loose caps and small drips escaping from them when placed on their sides. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: We covered the spill area with an absorbent product and swept up the material and removed it away from unloaders and their workspace.
